item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 6
item.description: Final 4.2 dev snapshot before we enter the beta phase, and it's absolutely feature-packed!
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 3.5.3
item.description: It's been way too long since our previous 3.5 maintenance release! This new Godot 3.5.3 fixes a number of important issues and adjusts to changing platform requirements.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.2 RC 1
item.description: It's long overdue for the second Godot 4.1 patch release! This release candidate contains a number of important fixes, including performance and stability improvements, so let's give it a good test.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 5
item.description: Penultimate 4.2 dev snapshot brings improvements to Android plugin API, the Tilemap editor, and, well, practically everything else — making it ready for beta testing next month.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Introducing the new Godot Development Fund
item.description: We are excited to introduce a major improvement in terms of funding the development efforts of the Godot Engine.
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: Godot XR update - September 2023
item.description: Updates on various things XR in Godot, a new version of the OpenXR plugin, a new version of the tools library and an update on Godot 4 support.
item.dc:creator: Bastiaan Olij

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 3.5.3 RC 1
item.description: A new maintenance update is in the works for the 3.5 stable branch, to update Android templates to target Android 13, and fix a number of other platform porting bugs.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 4
item.description: Progressing steadily towards the beta stage, the fourth dev snapshot brings a lot of improvements all around.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Godot Showcase - Usagi Shima
item.description: A relaxing, idle bunny collecting game made by Jess, a solo indie developer
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: gamescom, here we go!
item.description: Join us next week at the Godot booth during gamescom in Cologne from Wednesday the 23rd, to Friday the 25th. Don't miss the chance to say hello to the Godot team!
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 3
item.description: Slowly but surely, Godot 3.6 is shaping up to be a great release. This third snapshot adds long awaited 2D physics interpolation, and another great optimization with 2D hierarchical culling.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 3
item.description: One month into the release cycle for Godot 4.2, things are well under way. This third dev snapshot features a lot of improvements to C# and rendering.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

item.title: Godot Conference 2023: Call for Participations
item.description: Looking to share your expertise through a talk or workshop? Join us and make this an event to remember!
item.dc:creator: Julian Murgia

item.title: Godot Rendering Priorities: July 2023
item.description: The Godot rendering team continues to focus on stability, performance and usability
item.dc:creator: Clay John

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.0.4
item.description: A fresh pack of stability and documentation improvements for teams still using Godot 4.0 is officially out!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 2
item.description: Closing the first month of development of Godot 4.2, the second development snapshot includes both smaller improvements and bigger features.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.0.4 RC 1
item.description: A new batch of backported fixes for Godot 4.0 is ready for testing! Even if you aren't able to move to Godot 4.1 just yet, we can't leave you without support and improvements.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.2 dev 1
item.description: We are ready to share the first batch of improvements coming to Godot 4.2 later this year with the release of the first dev snapshot!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Join us at the Godot Conference 2023!
item.description: We are happy to announce that we are going to be hosting the 2023 GodotCon in Munich, Germany.
item.dc:creator: Emi

item.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.1.1
item.description: Hot on the heels of its parent release, here's Godot 4.1.1 — the first maintenance release of the 4.1 branch, with more stability and workflow improvements.
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1.1 RC 1
item.description: The first round of bugfixes and usability improvements for Godot 4.1 is ready for your consideration!
item.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

item.title: Godot Funding Breakdown & Hiring Process
item.description: This article aims to shed light on the current status of Godot's funding, hiring, and our plans for sustainable funding long term.
item.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

item.title: Godot 4.1 is here, smoother, more reliable, and with plenty of new features
item.description: Four months after the release of Godot 4.0, we are excited to bring you Godot 4.1 — an update with a focus on stability, performance, and polish.
item.dc:creator: Godot contributors

item.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.1 RC 3
item.description: A few more critical regressions were fixed, and the milestone is now 100% complete. Let's confirm that 4.1 is ready with a (final?) RC.
item.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde
